text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
The Summons Handbook provides guidelines for all IRS functions in one multifunctional handbook. This section discusses the summons enforcement procedures.
IRM 25.5.10.1(2) added new paragraph describing what this section is about, and the intended

IRM 25.5.10.3(5) added paragraph explaining that the Unites States District Court for the district in which the summoned person resides has the jurisdiction to compel the person to appear, testify, or produce the records.
IRM 25.5.10.3(6) added paragraph explaining the standards set by Powell for an enforceable summons.
25.5.10.4.1.3(2) clarified that letter to taxpayer is also known as the last chance letter.
IRM 25.5.10.4.1.3(3) added guidance that the last chance date needs to be at least 15 days from the date the case was referred to Associate Area Counsel.
IRM 25.5.10.4.3(5) clarified that Associate Area Counsel forwards the civil enforcement of summons request to the US Attorney for the area where the person resides or is found.

) If the witness presents a valid reason (such as illness) for not appearing on day fixed in the summons, that date may be continued by mutual agreement another date. To formally extend the compliance date of the summons: a. Prepare a letter to the summoned party and include: date of the original summons, new compliance date, and name of the summoned party. b. Mail the letter by certified mail or hand deliver it to the summoned party. (

) If a taxpayer or witness appears in response to a summons and claims the Fifth Amendment or another privilege, continue with the examination or interview. Ask the summoned person all questions necessary so the person asserting the privilege responds to each inquiry by either answering the questions and producing the documents, or asserting the claimed privilege. However, if the person summoned refuses to submit to questioning and the requests for documents, do not continue the interview. Make a record of the interview. Another IRS employee should attend the interview or examination a witness. Associate Area Counsel should be contacted in any case in which the taxpayer raises a constitutional defense to a summons.
